headline.print_headline: Once-Shunned Washington Legislator Is Embraced in Budget Vote

docs.snippet: State Senator Pam Roach had been removed from the Republican caucus in 2010 after repeated clashes with fellow lawmakers and staff members....
docs.abstract: Washington State Senator Pam Roach, once shunned by her fellow Republicans due to her volatile temper, has been embraced in order for the Republican caucus to exercise its control over the state's budget process with a one-vote majority.

docs.snippet: A veiled apology was offered after the Turkish prime minister, a crucial mediator, chastised Iran’s leaders for seeking to move talks from Turkey to Iraq or Syria....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Iran's leaders backpedal from their criticism of Turkey, the host of coming talks on disputed Iranian nuclear program, in possible indication of their concern about alienating the Turks at time when Iran is facing increased isolation.
docs.lead_paragraph: A veiled apology was offered after the Turkish prime minister, a crucial mediator, chastised Iran’s leaders for seeking to move talks from Turkey to Iraq or Syria.

headline.print_headline: Storm Continues After German Writer’s Poem Against Israel
headline.seo: Storm Continues After Günter Grass Poem Against Israel
headline.main: Storm Continues After German Writer’s Poem Against Israel

docs.snippet: The controversy over a poem by Günter Grass showed no signs of subsiding, even after he said that he meant to criticize the government and not Israel as a whole....
docs.abstract: Gunter Grass, Germany's most famous living writer, tries to quell controversy over poem he wrote that criticizes Israel, saying he did not mean to make a wholesale attack on the country, but only on the policies of Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu's government; poem mixes lyrical turns of phrase with discussions of the need for international supervision of both Israel's and Iran's nuclear programs, bluntly calling Israel a threat to world peace for its warnings that it might attack Iran's nuclear facilities.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and ETHAN BRONNER
byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Berlin, and Ethan Bronner from Jerusalem.

docs.lead_paragraph: The controversy over a poem by Günter Grass showed no signs of subsiding, even after he said that he meant to criticize the government and not Israel as a whole.

byline.contributor: Nikolas Leontopoulos and Dimitris Bounias contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Mixed Reviews On Program For Immigrants With Records
headline.seo: Mixed Reviews on Program for Immigrants with Criminal Records
headline.main: Mixed Reviews on Program for Immigrants With Records

docs.snippet: An effort to identify illegal immigrants who committed crimes led to confusion among authorities before it started to yield results, according to two reports from the inspector general....
docs.abstract: Homeland Security Dept inspector general issues back-to-back reports about the expansion of the Secure Communities program, purpose of which is to identify illegal immigrants who committed crimes; reports find that effort initially led to confusion among authorities before it started to yield results.
docs.lead_paragraph: An effort to identify illegal immigrants who committed crimes led to confusion among authorities before it started to yield results, according to two reports from the inspector general.
